source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_033_chunk5
evidence_span: FIGS. 8j, 8k, and 8l—Late beta quench w/alpha+beta final anneal
specimen_state: Late beta quench with alpha+beta final anneal

extra_properties.oxide_characteristics: bright areas caused by electron charging due to reduced conductivity of fractured/porous oxide
extra_properties.nodule_precursors: not raised or lifted blisters but areas of fractured oxide

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_033_chunk6
evidence_span: Many nodule precursors were observed after exposure to 500°C steam on materials expected to have both good and poor nodule resistance.
specimen_state: quenched from alpha+beta zone; beta-quenched; final anneal in alpha zone

extra_properties.intermetallic_distribution: high density along alpha-grain boundaries (alpha+beta quenched); finely dispersed (beta-quenched); large randomly distributed (alpha annealed)
extra_properties.corrosion_behavior: nodular corrosion in BWR; uniform corrosion in PWR

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_033_chunk7
evidence_span: Randomly distributed large intermetallic particles, shown in Fig. 14. Case 1, are typical of beta-quenching at slab thicknesses between 130 to 180 mm
corrosion_data: higher uniform oxidation rate in PWRs, higher weight gain before nodules visible in BWRs

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_033_chunk7
evidence_span: Alpha + beta annealing near final size causes the intermetallic particles to migrate to the grain boundaries (Fig. 14. Case 2)

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_033_chunk7
evidence_span: material that has been beta-quenched at slab thicknesses below 50 nm. Randomly distributed smaller sized intermetallic particles are shown in Fig. 14. Case 3
corrosion_data: higher oxidation rates in PWRs, higher weight gain before nodules visible in BWRs

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_033_chunk8
evidence_span: Metallographic examinations of SRA Zircaloy-4 tubings constitute the experimental data required for the determination of the accuracy of the corrosion models

extra_properties.operating_conditions: One to four cycles of irradiation in 900 MWe PWRs
extra_properties.application: waterside corrosion behavior in nuclear reactors

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_033_chunk9
evidence_span: Three cycles of irradiation in a four-loop PWRs characterized by a severe thermal/hydraulic environment. Four to five cycles of irradiation cycles of $4 . 5 \%$ EPY $^{ 2 3 5 } \mathrm { U }$ or $3 . 1 \%$ EPY $^{ 2 3 5 } \mathrm { U }$ enriched fuel rods leading to average rod burnups in the range of $4 8  0 0 0$ to $5 5 ~ 0 0 0 ~ \mathrm { M W d / t U }$ . 365 effective full power days in the CIRENE out-of-pile loop. $\bullet$ Autoclave tests.
conditions: PWR irradiation, burnup 48000-55000 MWd/tU, CIRENE out-of-pile loop

extra_properties.corrosion_assessment: measured vs calculated corrosion data comparison
